alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 8:27PM PST until January 15 at 1:11AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The Chehalis River at Porter will crest tonight and will fall below flood stage Friday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 48.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM PST Thursday was 48.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 41.1 feet Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning at 630 AM PST.
